content.content:
To create a new GitHub repository named "new_project" and invite all collaborators from "emmajohnson/image_transformation" as collaborators, you need to follow these steps:

1. Create a new repository: You can create a new repository by logging into your GitHub account and clicking on the "+" icon in the top right corner. Then, select "New repository" and fill in the required information, such as the repository name and description.

2. Get the collaborators from the existing repository: You can get the list of collaborators from the existing repository "emmajohnson/image_transformation" by going to the repository settings and clicking on the "Collaborators" tab.

3. Invite collaborators to the new repository: Once you have the list of collaborators, you can invite them to the new repository "new_project" by going to the repository settings and clicking on the "Collaborators" tab. Then, click on "Add collaborator" and enter the email addresses or usernames of the collaborators you want to invite.

Please note that you need to have the necessary permissions to create a new repository and invite collaborators. If you are not the owner of the repository, you may need to ask the owner to add you as a collaborator or to create the new repository.
